content: भावः [भू-भावे घञ्] {@--1@} Being, existing, existence; नासतो विद्यते भावः <ls>Bg. 2. 16.</ls> {@--2@} Becoming, occurring, taking place. {@--3@} State, condition, state of being; लताभावेन परिणतमस्या रूपं <ls>V. 4</ls>; <ls>U. 6. 23</ls>; so कातरभावः, विवर्णभावः &c. {@--4@} Manner, mode. {@--5@} Rank, station, position, capacity; देवीभावं गमिता <ls>K. P. 10</ls>; so प्रेष्यभावं; किंकरभावं &c. {@--6@} ({%a%}) True condition or state, truth, reality; <ls>Bg. 10. 8.</ls> ({%b%}) Sincerity, devotion; त्वयि भे भावनिबंधना रतिः <ls>R. 8. 52</ls>; <ls n="R.">2. 26.</ls> {@--7@} Innate property, disposition, nature, temperament; <ls>U. 6. 14.</ls> {@--8@} Inclination or disposition of mind, idea, thought, opinion, supposition; <ls>Pt. 3. 43</ls>; <ls>Ms. 8. 25</ls>; <ls n="Ms.">4. 65.</ls> {@--9@} Feeling, emotion, sentiment; एको भावः <ls>Pt. 3. 66</ls>; <ls>Ku. 6. 95.</ls> (In the dramatic science or in poetic compositions generally, {%Bhāvas%} are either स्थायिन् primary, or व्यभिचारिन् subordinate. The former are eight or nine, according as the {%Rasas%} are taken to be 8 or 9, each {%rasa%} having its own स्थायिभाव. The latter are thirty-three or thirty four in number, and serve to develop and strengthen the prevailing sentiment; for definition and enumeration of the several kinds, see <ls>R.</ls> G first {%ānana%}, or <ls>K. P. 4.</ls>). {@--10@} Love, affection, attachment; द्वंद्वानि भावं क्रि यया विवव्रुः <ls>Ku. 3. 35</ls>; कुमुद्वती भानुमतीव भावं (बबंध) <ls>R. 6. 36.</ls> {@--11@} Purport, drift, gist, substance; इति भावः (often used by commentators). {@--12@} Meaning, intention, sense, import; <ls>Māl. 1. 25.</ls> {@--13@} Resolution, determination. {@--14@} The heart, soul, mind; तयोर्विवृतभावत्वत् <ls>Māl. 1. 12</ls>; <ls>Bg. 17. 16.</ls> {@--15@} Any existing thing, an object, a thing, substance; जगति जयिनस्ते ते भावा नवेंदुकलादयः <ls>Māl. 1. 17</ls>, <ls n="Māl. 1.">36</ls>; <ls>R. 3. 41</ls>, <ls>U. 3. 32.</ls> {@--16@} A being, living creature. {@--17@} Abstract meditation, contemplation (= भावना <ab>q. v.</ab>). {@--18@} Conduct, movement. {@--19@} ({%a%}) Gesture, behaviour. ({%b%}) Amorous gesture or expression of sentiment, gesture of love; <ls>Ś. 2. 1.</ls> {@--20@} Birth. {@--21@} The world, universe. {@--22@} The womb. {@--23@} Will. {@--24@} Superhuman power. {@--25@} Advice, instruction. {@--26@} (In dramas) A learned or venerable man, worthy man, (a term of address); भाव अयमस्मि <ls>V. 1</ls>; तां खलु भावेन तथैव सर्वे वर्ग्याः पाठिताः <ls>Māl. 1.</ls> {@--27@} (In gram) The sense of an abstract noun, abstract idea conveyed by a word; भावे क्तः. {@--28@} A term for an impersonal passive or neuter verb. {@--29@} (In <ab>astr.</ab>) An astronomical house. {@--30@} A lunar mansion. {@--31@} An organ of sense.
